quest.name: To Bend with the Wind
journal: Relieved that you will not judge him and his fellow Blue Kojin harshly for the deeds of the Red, Soroban is eager to take you the rest of the way to Othard. He leaves with the others to ready his ship, and bids you inform the Confederates of your impending departure.

The Confederate with whom you speak reiterates that there is no need to pay the Ruby Tithe, though he and the others should be glad if you would consider purchasing supplies before leaving the island.

All due preparations made, you set forth, and Sakazuki recedes into the distance as the eastern coastline of Othard grows larger. Recalling that Tansui spoke of Doma's viceroy “holding court” in one of the fishing villages, you come ashore some distance from Isari, in case it should chance to be the selfsame village.

Agreements fulfilled and debts paid, you part ways with Soroban, and turn your attentions to Isari, which you soon discover to be occupied by imperial forces. From afar, you catch your first glimpse of Yotsuyu, the imperial viceroy, and Grynewaht of all people, who seems none the worse for the trouncings you dealt him in Gyr Abania and Carteneau. To the disgust and horror of your comrades, Yotsuyu forces one villager to execute another, before having him shot for refusing to kill his own parents. Incensed, Gosetsu resolves to end the madness by surrendering himself into the viceroy's custody, reasoning that she will wish to question him thoroughly, giving you time to formulate a rescue plan. Despite your comrades' protestations, the samurai will not be swayed, and you can only watch as he is led away into the local tavern.

Though Alisaie is frustrated by this turn of events, she recognizes that what is done is done, and that you have no choice but to find a solution. Recalling that Gosetsu bade you seek aid at the mysterious tower to the northeast, she takes to the water with Lyse, and begins swimming for the isle of Onokoro.

As Alisaie laments a brief moment of Alphinaud-like exposition, massive beasts with big, nasty teeth emerge from the water and howl in rage. Others are soon drawn to the commotion, and since discretion is the better part of valor, your comrades resolve to run, fending the beasts off as they go. You, meanwhile, decide to deal with the first two beasts before following suit.
Ravenous beasts are rarely a challenge for you, and these are no exception. Doubtless Lyse and Alisaie fared just as well...

As expected, you find your comrades standing over several slain beasts, none the worse for wear. The tower is not far, and you can almost make out the banners, which look rather familiar even at this distance.

It would seem that Gosetsu intended for you to seek the aid of the Confederacy, as the large settlement─complete with its own aetheryte─appears to be under their control. But given what Tansui told you before, there is surely little chance that they will answer your call.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So we can leave for Othard, right?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Hm. I suppose that shall have to suffice for now.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Hah! I told you he would not abandon us!

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: I shall return to the ship and prepare for our departure. If you have any remaining business to conduct with the pirates here, I pray you do so now.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Ah, that reminds me. Forename, would you be so kind as to inform the Confederates of our plans? The more they know of our movements, the less like we are to be mistaken for another vessel by their comrades.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Next stop, Othard...and Doma. We're coming, Yugiri...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Even if we need not fear the Confederacy, there is no telling what manner of imperial presence we will find waiting for us. We must be careful.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: What are we standing around for? Did you not hear what Tansui said? The viceroy must be stopped!

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Regardless of Tansui's assurances, I would take no chances and inform the pirates of our plans, lest the more unscrupulous among them decide to board us regardless. Stranger things have been known to happen...

dialogue.name: TESHITAPIRATE
dialogue.text: Oh, you're one of the ijin from the beach. Leaving us already?

dialogue.name: TESHITAPIRATE
dialogue.text: No need to pay the tithe, like Tansui said. On the other hand, if you were to peruse our wares and find anything to your liking, we should be glad to sell it to you for a fair price.

dialogue.name: TESHITAPIRATE
dialogue.text: Tansui seems to believe you're not the type to let a favor go unanswered. Assuming he's not mistaken, I've no doubt you could find a few odd jobs here.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: You have spoken with the Confederates up above, then? Excellent! If you are ready to depart, we may do so at any time.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: All aboard!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: One moment...

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Of course. Take as much time as you require.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Then let us be off! I shall deliver you to the fishing village of Isari.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Wait─Tansui said that the viceroy was “holding court” in one of the fishing villages, did he not?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Should Isari chance to be the village in question, we could instantly find ourselves surrounded by imperial soldiers. I think it safer to come ashore some distance away.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Very well! I know just the place.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Hmm... It would have been silly to try to swim all the way here. At least this time.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Still have your bearings? I know it can be difficult when you're on the water.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: At long last, I am returned to my homeland...

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Here we are! I am reasonably certain none bore witness to our approach.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: And with this, I believe I have fulfilled the terms of our agreement?

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Aye, that you have. You have my deepest thanks, Soroban. Truly, we are blessed to have befriended such a clever and industrious merchant!

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Oh, you are much too kind, good sir!

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: I know not where your path may lead, but I wish you the very best, and hope that we shall meet again.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So we've finally arrived in Othard. All we need to do now is, uh...liberate Doma.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text:
Ah, yes...that.
Look...daunting though it is, we do have one thing in our favor: the element of surprise. Unlike in Gyr Abania, the imperials don't know we're here.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Admittedly, that may be our only advantage, considering how few of us there are...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Well, I expect the Doman Liberation Front will even up the odds a bit. But before all that, we need to see if this is the fishing village Tansui was talking about.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: It may well be. I smell ceruleum on the breeze...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You heard him. Let's go!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I hate it as much as you. Maybe even more. Every fiber of my being was crying out to intervene, but...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But what's done is done. Gosetsu's gamble has gifted us the time we need to find a solution.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: He bade us seek aid at the distant tower, yes? For want of a better idea, I say we do just that─while taking care to avoid the imperials.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: She's right. This is not like the Reach. This is worse. They were defenseless...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We seem to have evaded their patrols so far...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: What is that tower, anyway? I've never seen anything like it.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: According to my map, we are on Onokoro, and the tower is known as Heaven–on–High. A mysterious structure built long ago by persons unknown...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Oh gods, listen to me. I'm starting to sound like Alphinaud. Next thing you know, I'll be saying things like, “As you are doubtless already aware...”

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Hm? Over there! Do you see it?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Hmm... Doesn't look like it's been dead long.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Whoever did this, they're a good shot. I can't see a single stray arrow.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Well, someone's hungry! Wait...that wasn't either of you two, was it.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text:
Calm down! We had nothing to do wi─
Wait, what am I doing? They can't possibly understand us.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Probably not, no...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Time to run, Lyse! We save our strength for any that give chase! You too, Forename!

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: The beasts howl in rage and charge!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Whew... That went better than expected.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Just imagine if they'd taken us by surprise. What a fine ending that would have been to our story...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Anyway, I think it's safe to assume that the people at the tower know how to defend themselves. You'd have to, sharing an island with these things. Now all we need to do is convince them to help us!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So that's the way of it...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Ohh...there's a settlement here! And they've even got their own aetheryte.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Wait a minute... I've seen that standard before. It was when we met with Tansui. Which means this place belongs to... Oh.
